summary: Email correspondence between a Boies Schiller Flexner LLP partner and an Assistant United States Attorney regarding a witness's journal entries from 1995-1996 that mention visits to Jeffrey Epstein's house and activities with him. The emails discuss the sharing of photographs and journal entries to assist in the investigation of Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Partner
persons.role: Attorney at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP
persons.context: Communicates with the Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding a witness's journal entries and photographs related to Epstein and Maxwell, facilitating evidence sharing for the investigation.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.role: Prosecutor in the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Requests journal entries and other documents from a witness to assist in the investigation of Epstein and Maxwell, following up on an interview.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in the witness's journal entries from 1996 regarding visits to his house and going to the movies with him.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned alongside Epstein in the context of the witness's experiences during the time period under investigation.

connections.description: Email exchange regarding evidence sharing (journal entries, photographs) for the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.
The partner's firm is involved in facilitating evidence (witness journal entries) that mentions Epstein.
Mentioned together as subjects of the investigation and in the witness's experiences.
The prosecutor is investigating Epstein, as evidenced by the request for journal entries mentioning him.

events.title: Witness's first journal entry
events.description: The witness's first journal entry from December 1995, written in fading colored pencil.

events.title: Witness visits Epstein's house
events.description: Journal entry describes the highlights of a New York trip and going to Jeffrey Epstein's house.

events.title: Witness goes to movies with Epstein
events.description: Journal entry describes going to the movies with Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Prosecutor's follow-up request for journal
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney follows up on a request for the witness's journal entries after an interview.

events.title: Journal entries provided
events.description: Partner confirms the witness's last journal entry was in late February and she went to New Mexico in April, and provides explanation of specific entries.

keyFacts: A witness's journal entries from 1995-1996 mention visiting Jeffrey Epstein's house and going to the movies with him.
The U.S. Attorney's Office requested these journal entries to assist in the investigation of Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
The witness's first journal entry from December 1995 was fading and hard to read, written in colored pencil.
The witness traveled to New Mexico in April, after her last journal entry in late February.
The correspondence shows active evidence gathering by prosecutors in January 2020 regarding Epstein/Maxwell.
